name: illuminative
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
giving you new information about a subject or making it easier to understand: He combines thorough quantitative analyses with several illuminative case studies to persuasively support his conclusions. These findings may not be conclusive, but they are illuminative.
More examplesFewer examplesIlluminative evaluation is a long process and involves the gathering of a large amount of data.The purpose of the study was to provide an illuminative account of nursing practice in pain management.This illuminative documentary highlights the director's dedication to achieving the perfect shot.
